workflow.name: Automate Twitter sentiment analysis with OpenAI, Google Sheets, and Slack alerts
workflow.description:
## ‚úÖ What problem does this workflow solve?

Tracking what people say about your brand on Twitter can be overwhelming, especially when important mentions slip through the cracks. This workflow automates the process: it scrapes Twitter mentions, analyzes sentiment using OpenAI, logs everything in a Google Sheet, and sends real-time Slack alerts for **negative tweets**. No manual monitoring needed.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è What does this workflow do?

1. Runs on a schedule to monitor Twitter mentions or hashtags.
2. Uses **Apify** to scrape tweets based on brand keywords.
3. Filters out tweets already processed (avoids duplicates).
4. Performs **sentiment analysis** with OpenAI (Positive, Neutral, Negative).
5. Logs tweet content, sentiment, and reply (if any) in a Google Sheet.
6. Sends an instant **Slack notification** for negative tweets.
7. Generates thank-you replies for positive tweets and logs them.

---

## üîß Setup Instructions

### üóì Schedule Trigger
- Use the Cron node to schedule checks (e.g., every hour, daily).

### üê¶ Apify Twitter Scraper Setup
- Sign up on [Apify](https://apify.com/)
- Generate your **Apify API Token** and use it in the HTTP node to run the actor and get tweet results.

### ü§ñ OpenAI Sentiment Analysis
- Get your API key from [OpenAI](https://platform.openai.com)

### üìÑ Google Sheet Configuration
Prepare a Google Sheet with this [sample format](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sOxYQtX-O6p35FCNSRsovKEHL4w4GsfF-ylMVcwpb_E/edit?gid=1040262065#gid=1040262065).

Connect it using the Google Sheets node in n8n.

### üí¨ Slack Notifications
- Connect your Slack workspace via the Slack node.
- Set up the channel where negative tweets should be sent as alerts.

---

## üß† How it Works

### 1. Scheduled Run
Triggered at a fixed interval using the Schedule (Cron) node.

### 2. Scrape Mentions from Twitter
- The Apify actor runs and collects recent tweets mentioning your brand or using your hashtag.
- Links to the tweets are extracted.

### 3. Filter Previously Seen Tweets
- Each tweet is checked against the Google Sheet.
- If already present, it‚Äôs skipped to avoid duplicate analysis.

### 4. Analyze Sentiment with OpenAI
- For new tweets, sentiment is classified into:
  - ‚úÖ Positive
  - ‚ö™ Neutral
  - ‚ùå Negative

### 5. Store Results in Google Sheet
- The tweet link, content, and sentiment are stored in a row.
- If sentiment is **positive**, a thank-you reply is also generated and saved.

### 6. Notify Slack for Negative Tweets
- When a tweet is tagged **Negative**, a Slack message is sent to the designated channel with the tweet link.

---

## üë§ Who can use this?

This workflow is ideal for:
- üì¢ **Social Media Teams**
- üß† **PR and Brand Managers**
- üßë‚Äçüíª **Solo Founders**
- üè¢ **Startups & SaaS Companies**

Stay ahead of your brand's reputation‚Äî**automatically**.

---

## üõ† Customization Ideas

- üéØ Add filters for specific campaign hashtags.
- üì¨ Send weekly summary reports via email.
- üì• Auto-open support tickets for negative mentions.
- üó£ Expand sentiment categories with more detailed tagging.

---

## üöÄ Ready to get started?

Just plug in:
- üîë Your Apify API Token
- üîë Your OpenAI API Key
- üìÑ Your Google Sheet
- üí¨ Your Slack Channel

Then deploy the workflow, and let it monitor Twitter for you!

values.content:
=You are a professional Twitter social media user replying to the original poster (admin).

Analyze the sentiment of the tweet below. If the sentiment is positive, write a short, thoughtful reply **from a user's perspective**, directed to the person who posted it.

The reply should:
- Show appreciation, agreement, or excitement
- Be friendly, intelligent, and relevant to tech or AI fields
- Use no emojis
- Be under 160 characters
- Address the original poster directly as a real person would

Tweet:
"""
use a user prompt
"""

options.systemMessage: You are a helpful AI assistant.Perfectly analyze the sentiment of this tweet_text and tell me in one word it is Positive, Neutral, or Negative.

nodes.name: Send negative post message on slack

parameters.text: =Received a Negative retweet on {{ $('Check Duplicate').item.json.TweetUrl }}. Consider if a response or clarification is needed.

nodes.name: Request for Twitter Post via Apify

parameters.content:
## Sample Output Sheet
- https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sOxYQtX-O6p35FCNSRsovKEHL4w4GsfF-ylMVcwpb_E/edit?usp=sharing


## Workflow Summary
This n8n workflow is designed to automate the collection, sentiment analysis, and response process for trending content. It uses the Apify API(https://apify.com/) to fetch trending data, performs sentiment analysis, and takes conditional actions based on the results. All outcomes are logged in a Google Sheet for record-keeping and future insights.

## How to Use Apify API in n8n for Trending Data
 ### API Endpoint
**Use this Apify Actor to fetch trending data via a POST request**
*https://api.apify.com/v2/acts/scraper_one~x-posts-search/run-sync?token=YOUR_API_TOKEN*
Important: Replace YOUR_API_TOKEN with your actual Apify API token.

### Request Body Format
{
  "search": "YOUR TOPIC", 
  "mode": "latest",
  "maxItems": 10
}

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
